; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 21:25:03 +0800 指定居所监视居住，不能走样变形丨法眼http://www.infzm.com/contents/258078
;;2023-10-04 20:00:00;
;

;;

;

;On September 14, 2023, on the first floor of Xinle Hotel, Xinle City, Hebei Province, there are The four walls of the room are all soft walls. The father of Bao Qinrui, the "resident" person, said that they had been placed under residential surveillance here. ;(Han Qian/Photo);

;

;Residential surveillance in a designated residence (hereinafter referred to as "residence") is a criminal coercive measure. Recently, an unfortunate incident was linked to this coercive measure, making people rethink this system:

;

;In the early morning of July 7, 2022, the police removed 33-year-old Bao Qinrui from Shijiazhuang, where he lived. He was taken away from his home in Yuhua District. Soon, his wife was informed that Bao Qinrui was living in Xinle City (a county-level city under the jurisdiction of Shijiazhuang) on ​​suspicion of picking quarrels and provoking trouble. Thirteen days after "Zhiju", Bao Qinrui passed away. (;For details, please see the Southern Weekend App report on September 19 ";The person who was "accused" passed away, and the police said that the other co-defendants "should not pursue criminal responsibility";》;)

;

;The cause of Qinrui's death will be revealed here Putting it aside and focusing on the accusation of violence against Qin Rui - how this criminal coercive measure is carried out and how it should operate is worthy of re-examination.

;

;;Residential surveillance, divided into two;

;

;my country's 1979 Criminal Procedure Law stipulates five coercive measures - summons, release on bail pending trial, residential surveillance, There has been neither an increase nor a decrease in detentions and arrests.

;

;Residential surveillance was originally a milder form and was not considered a "custodial measure" at first.

;

;Residential surveillance stipulated in Paragraph 2 of Article 38 of the 1979 Criminal Procedure Law is very simple, "The defendant under residential surveillance shall not leave the designated area. Residential surveillance shall be carried out by the local public security police station, or by an entrusted The people's commune and the unit where the defendant works shall be implemented." At that time, suspects and defendants were collectively referred to as "defendants", and residential surveillance measures did not distinguish between "residences" where they lived. Judging from the application of this measure, residential surveillance is a non-custodial measure. Although the scope of activities of suspects and defendants is restricted, their personal freedom is not deprived.

;

;In 1996, when the Criminal Procedure Law was revised, residential surveillance measures separated a "residential residence" from the residential surveillance that restricts personal freedom, and was used for suspects and defendants who "have no fixed residence" The suspects and defendants are required to "not leave their designated residence without approval" and the scope of their personal freedom is narrowed to "the designated residence".

;

;From the semantic point of view of the legal provisions, "not leaving without permission" is a restriction on the person who is "designated to live". The suspects and defendants still have personal freedom to "leave" the designated residence. The possibility, that is, not being completely deprived, probably belongs to a kind of "house arrest." However, in practice, being "resident" is no longer the original meaning of "residential surveillance", but has become a kind of detention, which is just different from being detained in a detention center like detention or arrest.

;

;In 2012, the Criminal Procedure Law was revised again, and the conditions for release on bail pending trial and residential surveillance were separated. Only those who meet the arrest conditions and legal circumstances can be released on bail pending trial. Article 73 of the law stipulates: "Residential surveillance shall be carried out after the crime has been committed." The execution may be carried out at the residence of the suspect or defendant; if there is no fixed residence, the execution may be carried out at a designated residence. For suspected crimes endangering national security, crimes of leaving terrorist activities, or particularly serious bribery crimes, execution at the residence may hinder the investigation, after the previous With the approval of the People's Procuratorate at the highest level and the public security organ, enforcement can also be carried out in a designated residence. However, it cannot be carried out in a place of detention or a special case handling place."

;

;So far, the legislation has tacitly approved the use of residential surveillance in a designated residence as a form of surveillance. This hidden meaning can also be seen in the practice of various detention measures, and the applicable conditions for residential surveillance are closer to the conditions for arrest.

;

;In this way, residential surveillance has changed from a non-custodial measure to a custodial measure, and the suspects and defendants who have been "residenced" are deprived of their personal freedom. Not only that, the place of residential surveillance has also become a place of interrogation.

;

;;Become ;; a temporary “case handling place” ;

;

;Article 73 of the Criminal Procedure Law stipulates that “it shall not be used in places of detention, specialized It is not prohibited to turn a residence under designated residential surveillance into a temporary "case-handling place". In fact, the measure of residential surveillance has become an investigative measure to obtain confessions due to the designated residence.

;

;This combination of detention and interrogation means that for the case-handling agency, the interrogation conducted at the designated residence is subject to few external constraints, and the interrogation process is conducive to the control and regulation of the case-handling personnel.

;

;Interrogation is conducted in a confined space outside a detention center. If the rights of criminal suspects and defendants are not to be infringed, they must submit obediently and provide the confessions expected by the investigators on a tap; or the investigators must comply with the interrogation. Standardize and consciously restrain the inertia and impulse of illegal evidence collection. When criminal suspects and defendants are not docile and actively cooperate, torture, torture, and corporal punishment and abuse can easily occur.

;

;Since the place of "residence" is also a temporary "case handling place", the case handlers in the pre-trial stage also become caretakers. Therefore, eliminating outside interference has become an inevitable choice. Not only are close relatives of people under such residential surveillance not allowed to meet with them, even lawyers are not allowed to meet with them, and they cannot even know where the criminal suspects or defendants are designated to live.

;

;The defense lawyer complained that the accused residents’ rights to lawyers were not even as good as those of criminal suspects and defendants when they were detained in the detention center, because criminal suspects and defendants could still meet with their lawyers in the detention center. , but they are not allowed to meet him while under residential surveillance, creating a reality that is obviously disproportionate to the principle of proportionality.

;

;It is worth noting that the close relatives of the accused resident are not informed of their designated place during the pretrial proceedings. Article 161 of the Supreme People's Court's "Interpretation on the Application of the Criminal Procedure Law of the People's Republic of China" Paragraph 2 stipulates that the close relatives of the parties should be notified of the reason and location of residence. This is because after investigation, review and prosecution of the case, it is no longer necessary to obtain confessions from the defendant outside the court. Therefore, the details of the coercive measures taken have also changed. The accusation without the function of obtaining confessions is undoubtedly closer to the essence of residential surveillance.

;

;;The non-custodial nature should be returned;

;

;According to the name, if "resident residence" is still a "residential surveillance" measure, it should be related to the custodial measure. Essentially different, not just a formal and meaningful difference in the form of a place of detention. In other words, people under residential surveillance should have a certain degree of personal freedom. If this freedom is completely deprived, it is a measure of detention rather than residential surveillance.

;

;Although nothing can be seen from the provisions of the Criminal Procedure Law itself, in actual case handling, residential surveillance at a designated location has indeed lost its essence of residential surveillance and has become a detention measure. During the Republic of my country, the Criminal Procedure Law of our country already included "residential surveillance". This measure existed as an alternative to detention, or as a measure to release from detention. The current residential surveillance is slightly different from the word order, but the nature of this measure is originally the same. Confusing residential surveillance with detention measures, even though there are differences in detention places, is still a flaw in the design of the criminal justice system or an act that exceeds legal boundaries in judicial practice.

;

;Personal freedom is a basic human right second only to the right to life and health, and is guaranteed by the solemn commitment of the Constitution. Personal freedom is not absolute. Personal freedom can be restricted or deprived for the needs of social defense, the need for litigation and evidence preservation, the need for the personal preservation of the person being prosecuted, and as a penalty measure.

;

;However, deprivation of personal freedom—whether as a social defense measure, a litigation safeguard measure, or a punishment method—needs to go through legal due process, that is, it is decided by the judicial authority, which leads to the judicial monopoly of the power of imprisonment. Sexuality and inalienability, non-judicial authorities may not deprive personal liberty for the above purposes.

;

;It is worth noting that the deprivation of personal liberty stipulated in the Constitution as a protective measure appears with the word "arrest". "Arrest" in the Constitution cannot be understood as an arrest in various coercive measures in criminal proceedings. It should be understood in a broad sense, that is, any arrest substance, no matter what the name is, will be regarded as an "arrest" in the Constitution and must be carried out in accordance with the Constitution. The prescribed restrictions are implemented - approval or decision of the People's Procuratorate and decision of the People's Court.

;

;The deprivation of personal freedom as a protective measure in our country ignores the broad nature of "arrest" in the Constitution. In addition to arrest, there are many personal freedoms that have the same essence as arrest but do not appear in the name of arrest. Deprivation measures have caused the constitutional guarantee of personal freedom to become undistributed in practice. Zhiju refers to a detention measure that is not in the name of "arrest" and is not held in a detention place but has the same essence as arrest.

;

;The death of Bao Qinrui gives us the opportunity to examine the custodialization of residential surveillance and let us think: we should return residential surveillance to its non-custodial nature and avoid confusing its essence with custodial measures.

; Wed, 04 Oct 2023 18:25:03 +0800 闹剧过后，我们如何寻找外星生命？http://www.infzm.com/contents/258060

;

;The Earth is the only celestial body that we currently know has life, but whether the Earth has life in the universe The issue of isolated islands has been debated endlessly. The topic of UFOs and aliens has always been a hot topic of public concern, triggering continuous discussions and becoming a classic theme in science fiction works. At the same time, scientists are also trying to use scientific methods to study this field and look beyond the earth to search for signs of life on exoplanets.

;

;;Remains of extraterrestrial creatures;;Farce;

;

;There are endless revelations about aliens around the world, most of which are due to lack of evidence. Can't make much of a splash. However, the appearance of the remains of two suspected "alien creatures" at a hearing in the Mexican Congress attracted widespread attention from the media and the public.

;

;On September 12, 2023, local time, the Mexican Congress held the first public hearing related to the "Unidentified Anomalous Phenomena, UAP" in the capital, Mexico City. At this hearing, Mexican journalist, author and UFO enthusiast Jaime Maussan presented his "discovery" of the remains of two suspected "alien creatures".

;

;According to Mozan, the two remains were discovered in a diatom mine in Cusco, Peru, in 2017. After dating by the National Autonomous University of Mexico, the two remains were dated 1,800 years ago. years and 700 years. As can be seen from the pictures at the scene, the remains have an elongated head and three fingers on each hand. The appearance of the two remains is very similar to the alien images described in some science fiction works, causing heated discussions on social media.

;

;Mossan stated: "These two remains have nothing to do with humans." However, the "alien creatures" mentioned by Moosang immediately aroused huge doubts. This is not the first time that Moissan has thrown out similar news. In 2015, Mossan claimed to have discovered the remains of a suspected "alien creature" in Peru and held a ticketed tour. However, the remains were later confirmed to be the mummified remains of a child. In 2017, Mozan claimed to have discovered the remains of "alien creatures" in the Nazca region of Peru, but was immediately refuted by Peruvian officials.

;

;The so-called "evidence" Moissan gave this time is also unconvincing. In response to Mosan's statement, the National Accelerator Mass Spectrometry Laboratory of the National Autonomous University of Mexico re-issued a statement that was first released in 2017. The laboratory said in a statement that they were not involved in collecting the samples and had not seen the entire specimen. Therefore, they were only responsible for testing the age of the samples submitted for inspection and would not draw conclusions about the source of the samples. Mosang also claimed that he invited forensic doctors to use X-ray scanning technology to examine the remains and found that there were egg-like structures in the remains. Julieta Fierro, a scientist at the Astronomy Research Center of the National Autonomous University of Mexico, criticized this, saying that more advanced technology than X-ray scanning would be needed to determine whether the two remains were human. Antígona Segura, an astrobiologist at the Nuclear Science Research Center of the National Autonomous University of Mexico, even said: "These conclusions are not supported by evidence at all. The whole thing is shameful."

;

;The Mexican Congress held this hearing to discuss the AirSpace Protection Law (AirSpace Protection Law) and promote relevant legislation. If this law is passed, Mexico will become the first country in the world to recognize "extraterrestrial life forms" "Country that exists. However, after the hearing, the Mexican Congress did not provide conclusive opinions, and the future of this bill is still unclear. Sergio Gutierrez, a member of the Mexican Congress, said: "We are paying attention to this issue and we can continue to discuss it." However, after being criticized by the scientific community, Moissan's "discovery" this time There is a high probability that it will end hastily again.

;

;;New ;;Report;

;

;When the remains of "alien creatures" once again arouse people's attention to extraterrestrial creatures, The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) held a press conference at its headquarters in Washington, DC, on September 14, 2023, local time, and released the latest research report of an independent research team formed by the agency to study unknown anomalies.

;

;NASA defines "unidentified anomalies" as "observations in the sky that cannot be scientifically identified as aircraft or known natural phenomena." On June 9, 2022, NASA announced the establishment of this research team. The team is composed of 16 experts from different fields such as astronomy, physics, meteorology, etc. These disciplines have varying degrees of connection with the study of unknown anomalies. .

;

;NASA believes that researchers have now obtained a certain number of high-quality observations of unknown abnormal events, and have the basic conditions to draw solid scientific conclusions about the nature of these events. Therefore, NASA established this independent research group to examine unidentified anomalies from a scientific perspective and develop a roadmap for how to use data and scientific tools to advance our understanding of unidentified anomalies.

;

;The public can download the 36-page report from NASA's official website. The report consists of several parts: the first part briefly introduces the research team and this report, the middle part answers questions such as how the team conducted the research in the form of 8 questions and answers, and the last part is the conclusions, suggestions and Acknowledgments.

;

;The research team concluded in this report that there is currently no evidence to support the existence of aliens, and most UFO incidents can be explained by science. But at the same time, they haven't completely ruled out the possibility of aliens. While the conclusions are not unexpected, the report is important in suggesting what possible data NASA could collect in the future to explore the nature and origins of unidentified anomalies.

;

;In a press release, NASA Administrator Bill Nelson said: "At NASA, it's in our DNA to explore and ask why things are the way they are. I would like to express my gratitude to the independent research team for inspiring us on how to better study and analyze unidentified anomalies in the future." He also emphasized that NASA's goal is to shift people's discussion of unidentified anomalies from fantasy to science level.

;

;At a press conference, NASA said that it has appointed a new director of unidentified anomaly research, who will lead the research team to strengthen artificial intelligence in the process of collecting and analyzing data and the use of machine learning. The report also highlights the need to enhance the application of new technologies in future research.

;

;;The answer may be on extrasolar planets;;Planet;

;

;Efforts to find alien life on Earth are based on the fact that alien life has visited the Earth. Such a premise limits the search scope to intelligent creatures capable of reaching the earth. But just as life forms on Earth vary widely, if there is life elsewhere in the universe, it may not be intelligent life, but rudimentary forms like microorganisms on Earth. So when astronomers set their sights on the search for exoplanets, they will be on the lookout for any possible signs of life.

;

;On September 11, 2023, at the James Webb Space Telescope’s first year of operation meeting held in Baltimore, Maryland, the United States, an international research team led by the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom announced the results of a famous satellite. This is the latest research result of the exoplanet K2-18 b. They found methane and carbon dioxide in the planet's atmosphere. This is the first time astronomers have found carbon-based molecules in the atmosphere of an exoplanet located in the habitable zone. At the same time, they may also have discovered what is believed to be a chemical on Earth. Chemical substances related to life activities. The research results will also be published in the Astrophysical Journal Letters.

;

;This exoplanet is 120 light-years away from the Earth, has a mass about 8.6 times that of the Earth, and a radius 2.6 times that of the Earth. It orbits the cold dwarf star K2-18 and is located in the habitable zone of this system. . Astronomers first probed the planet's atmosphere using the Hubble Space Telescope, but its composition was controversial at the time. After research, astronomers classified this planet into a category of exoplanets called "Hycean exoplanet". Such planets have hydrogen-rich atmospheres and ocean-covered planetary surfaces. There are no planets of this size between Earth and Neptune in our solar system. Since then, they have used the James Webb Space Telescope to study the planet in more detail.

;

;Using the high-resolution instruments of the James Webb Space Telescope, they confirmed in newly published research that the planet's atmosphere contains methane and carbon dioxide. At the same time, they also found a weak signal in the spectrum of K2-18 b. Analysis showed that this signal may be generated by a molecule called dimethyl sulphide (DMS). On Earth, we currently know that dimethyl sulfide can only be produced by life activities. Most of the dimethyl sulfide in the Earth's atmosphere is released by marine phytoplankton, which indicates that it may also exist on K2-18 b similar life activities.

;

;“Our findings highlight the diverse considerations that need to be taken into account in the search for life elsewhere,” said Nikku Madhusudhan, an astronomer at the University of Cambridge in the United Kingdom and lead author of the paper. The importance of habitable environments. The search for life on exoplanets has traditionally focused on smaller, rocky planets, but larger hydrogen-marine planets are clearly more amenable to atmospheric observations."

;

;However, , astronomers still need further observations to confirm the existence of dimethyl sulfide. Madhusudhan said that subsequent observations by the James Webb Telescope will confirm whether dimethyl sulfide is indeed present in the atmosphere of K2-18 b. This research team believes that K2-18 b and other hydrogen sea planets may be excellent places for us to discover life outside the solar system.

;

;The James Webb Space Telescope has been in use for more than a year, demonstrating its powerful observation capabilities and constantly surprising astronomers. As more and more powerful space telescopes and ground-based telescopes are put into use, constructed or put on the development schedule, astronomers will gain increasingly powerful capabilities to observe exoplanets. Maybe discovering extraterrestrial life on Earth is just a fantasy, but if extraterrestrial life really exists, we will be able to detect signs of their activities on an exoplanet in the near future.

;Halfway through the long holiday, the Midi Music Festival held in Nanyang, Henan suddenly appeared on the social media hot search list, not because How well done, but because - "stealing things". For this city that was once famous for Zhuge Wolong, if the case cannot be solved as soon as possible, not only may the next Midi Music Festival be ruined, but it will also affect the reputation of the entire city.

;

;On October 3, the keywords "Midi steals things" quickly became hot topics on social media. According to information released by netizens at the scene, the music festival had ended the day before, and many music fans who participated in the music festival had not yet evacuated. However, a large number of nearby villagers went into the campground to search for things. According to Solitaire’s stolen property statistics, some people’s clothing and shoes were stolen, some wine and tea were stolen, some camping equipment such as tents, sleeping bags, and moisture-proof mats were lost, and high-value electronic and digital products such as computers, mobile phones, cameras, and recording equipment were stolen. Some "thiefs" only took away the tent, leaving other materials neatly in place. Even the fist-thick cables on the stage were stolen.

;

;According to self-reported information by the thieves, the total value of the stolen materials may reach hundreds of thousands of yuan. A video circulating on the Internet shows a middle-aged woman who was caught taking something out of her bag while defending herself: "We just went to get it when no one was there," as if the owner of the tent had temporarily left ( Maybe you go out to eat or even just use the toilet), the things in the tent become ownerless and can be taken as you please.

;

;As the first original music festival in China, the Midi Music Festival with a history of more than 20 years has become one of the most famous carnivals in the Chinese music industry, especially rock music. For the venue where the music festival is held, tens of thousands of enthusiastic music fans from all over the country will not only bring direct income to the local area, but also become an excellent opportunity to promote the local area. Therefore, many cities, especially third- and fourth-tier cities, are competing to hold or invite large-scale music festivals to be held locally.

;

;This Midi Music Festival was held in Nanyang and also received great attention from the local area. According to the official social media account "Nanyang Release" of the Nanyang Municipal Government Information Office, on September 29, the opening day of the Central Plains Midi Music Festival, the Secretary of the Nanyang Municipal Party Committee and the Mayor, wearing red volunteer uniforms, personally greeted the guests at the exit of Nanyang Railway Station. Music fans all over the country. Half a month ago, Nanyang City held a preparatory meeting for the Midi Music Festival. The Secretary of the Municipal Party Committee personally made arrangements and required the establishment of a high-standard headquarters at the municipal level to carefully carry out various guarantee work for the music festival.

;

;A few days before the opening of the music festival, the Nanyang Municipal Government Information Office also released a city image promotional video and a local "food, drink, and fun picture" through its official account to promote local tourism resources. Such high-standard preparation and reception highlight the importance attached to the music festival. It was with this kind of attention that the music festival itself seemed to go without any problems. However, what was unexpected was that large-scale thefts occurred after the festival. It can be said that the previous efforts were ruined. This makes the previous official statement of “protecting the personal and property safety of tourists” a joke.

;

;In addition to theft, netizens who attended the music festival accused some people of harassing tourists in the name of toasting during dinner in the hotel, and even beating tourists while drunk.

;

;This information spreads rapidly through social networks. If the local area fails to take prompt measures to identify problems such as theft and harassment, it will greatly damage the image of the local area. In addition to the stolen music fans who said that if there is no result in handling this incident, they will never visit Nanyang again. Some netizens also said that they felt very unsafe after watching the video of the villagers taking things away, and they will definitely do so when traveling in the future. Avoid this place.

;

;According to the descriptions of the thieves and live music fans, most of the thieves were local villagers, who even used tricycles to pull the items. This scene can't help but remind people of the situations that have happened in many places before where villagers stole the crops of foreign agricultural entrepreneurs. It was reported in the summer of 2019 that a sweet potato farmer in Henan contracted 200 acres of land to grow watermelons. When the watermelons matured, nearby villagers gathered in groups to steal the melons. A melon-picking incident also occurred in Jiaxing, Zhejiang, where almost all the watermelons from more than 20 greenhouses were stolen. Some melon thieves were even caught by melon farmers and fell to the ground and were "injured" during the pulling process. Instead, the melon farmers were asked to pay compensation.

;

;In these theft incidents, some places often use various excuses to excuse local farmers. For example, it is not "theft", but they believe the rumor that "the owner doesn't want it anymore", or there are people in the local area who are not the owners. The tradition of “picking up the leaks” after harvesting, etc. In the Midi Music Festival theft incident, some participants alleged that after catching the thief and calling the police, the police let the villagers go because "there was no evidence to prove the theft." If the property of participants cannot be protected for a large-scale event that the government attaches so much importance to, who will dare to come here in the future?

;

;It is true that the quality of villagers in some places is not high, they are greedy for petty gains, and their legal awareness is weak. They have the idea that the law does not punish the public, and they feel that taking some things from "outsiders" will not do anything. If local officials do not take severe measures to punish these thieving villagers and cannot effectively protect the interests of foreign tourists or investors, and their reputation is ruined, no one will dare to travel or invest here again.

;

;According to the announcement from the Midi Music Festival Organizing Committee, the local police have set up a task force to investigate the theft cases. Some fans also reported that some of the stolen items had been recovered. This time Nanyang must make every effort to solve the case, recover the stolen goods, reduce the losses of music fans, and at the same time severely punish the thieves without mercy. Only in this way can it be possible to restore the reputation, restore the music festival, restore the music fans, and restore the tourists from all over the country.
